page.title: 08Housing in East Kilbride
page.content: In our area are to be found the very oldest houses which pre-date the New Town. These village houses are mainly of stone with slate roofs. Between the wars houses made of brick covered in roughcast were built but still with a slate roof. These are mostly four in a block houses with back and front gar- dens. These were built around the vil- lage and because of their age have re- cently been renovated inside and out. New Town building consists mainly of terraced and to a lesser extent semi- detached houses with a variety of building materials. There is only one block of multi-storey flats in our area. Private houses are built mainly on the outskirts, usually in estates, (a mixture of semi-detached and de- tached), the latest of which is to be 2000 houses at Stewartfield which was Green Belt Area until very recently.
